workflow_runs.name: WebAssembly
workflow_runs.display_title: Fix crash on linux in the pingsenders - VPN-3572 (#5725)

head_commit.message:
Fix crash on linux in the pingsenders - VPN-3572 (#5725)

In a few ping sender implementations, we emit signals in loop (while-stmt and
for-stmt), but the slots connect to them, trigger the deletion of the entire object.
At the next cycle of the same loop, the object is not valid anymore and we crash.

The solution is to queue the slots and allow the ping-sender loops to complete
before processing the data.

workflow_runs.display_title: Do not treat settings reset as a location change - VPN-3293 (#5678)

head_commit.message:
Do not treat settings reset as a location change - VPN-3293 (#5678)

Note that this could be reproducible via a simple logout.  The bug is in the
retranslate request (ServerData::changed signal) when the language code changes
because of a setting reset.  The signal is received by the RecentConnection
model, which adds the "new" server location to its lists.

This PR renames VPNRecentConnections to VPNRecentConnectionsModel to avoid
conflicts with a nebula QML component.

workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-3508 - part 14 - Cleanup networkRequests (#5503)

head_commit.message:
VPN-3508 - part 14 - Cleanup networkRequests (#5503)

* VPN-3508 - part 14 - Cleanup networkRequests

In this commit I do the following:
- implement a callback system to overwrite the default network behavior (unit-test, wasm)
- move the single network request constructors in the corresponding code
- move networkrequest.{cpp,h} into /src/shared
- remove mocnetworkrequest from unit-tests

Revising the network-request implementation I also found a bug (and fixed it) in
the benchmark task logic where, if the upload is slower than the download, we
do not show the proper error message.

* Comment applied

* Let's allow network request callbacks to do not block the network ops

* Add appconstants.h header

* Check requested headers in functional tests

* Disable header-checks in wasm (because we don't expose headers to JS)

* Validate query params and body

* Remove the use of token in the NetworkRequest CTOR

workflow_runs.name: WebAssembly
workflow_runs.display_title: VPN-2934 - Fix device limit issues when logging out manually from oth…

head_commit.message:
VPN-2934 - Fix device limit issues when logging out manually from other device (#4623)

* Start periodic operations timer whenver a token is available

1. That is all we need to run those operations
2. That ensures the operations are run also when in the device limit
   screen.

* Skip device check when in StateDeviceLimit

* Always enqueue a remove device task regardless if device is in
DeviceModel

TaskRemoveDevice already deals with the possibility of the device
not being registered to the given user. No need to handle
that in multiple places.

Also by not launching task remove device, operations to take
user out of device limit state don't happen and that leaves users
trapped in device limit screen.

workflow_runs.name: WebAssembly
workflow_runs.display_title: Update xcodebuild script to only build for x86_64 arch (#3972)

head_commit.message:
Update xcodebuild script to only build for x86_64 arch (#3972)

With the change from Apple to switch to arm64 on new macbooks
the default value of the ARCHS_STANDARD configuration is 'arm64 x86_64'.

Since the VPN app does not support arm64 architectures yet,
this is an issue (see: https://mozilla-hub.atlassian.net/browse/VPN-82).
It became an apparent issue, though, after the addition of the
signature Rust library to the codebase.

Rust will only build for the active architecture (x86_64), while xcode
will attempt to build for both. That was causing a linker error.
